intro: Synaedrys baviensis, commonly known as the Baviensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
